page.title: 12NORTHWOOD HSE/NORRIS CASTLE
page.content:
{NORTHWOOD HOUSE was built in 1837.It was designed by John Nash for George Henry Ward,in the Grecian style. It has been the home for the Wards, the Benedictine nuns,(expelled from France in 1901),a Red Cross hospital in World War 1,and since 1929 a home for local government.It is the most stately council chamber in Britain.
{NORRIS CASTLE The present castle was built between 1795 and 1805 in the Georgian style by James Wyatt for Henry Seymour.Victoria and her mother stayed there between 1832 and Victoria's ascent to the throne in 1837.Mrs.Lacon the present owner has restored the farm.Ponies and cattle are bred there.Norris castle is open to the public during the summer.
